flow.descriptionCdata:
4d9997ee-411c-4da5-a0b5-4813e004ceda.405f87de-6ad2-426a-8061-c2f79412def7.prompt=timeout\: 4d9997ee-411c-4da5-a0b5-4813e004ceda.531526ff-c8f6-4781-86b7-184ad6b1ebae.prompt=Database Type 4d9997ee-411c-4da5-a0b5-4813e004ceda.80cdc62e-64a2-4a1c-ab06-7e29931b0dd2.description=
Runs a SQL SELECT query.
The first row is returned on the first run of the operation.
Subsequent calls with the same information will return the other rows.

Inputs\:
    DBServerName - The hostname or ip address of db server.
    DbType - The type of database to connect to. 
Valid values\: Oracle, MSSQL, Sybase, Netcool, DB2 and Custom.
Default value\: Oracle
    Username - The username to use when connecting to the server.
    Password -  The password to use when connecting to ther server.
    instance - The name instance of MSSQL Server. Leave it blank for default instance.
    DbPort - The port to connect to.
Default values\: Oracle\: 1521, MSSQL\: 1433, Sybase\: 5000, Netcool\: 4100, DB2\: 50000.
    Database - The name of the database.
    authenticationType - The type of authentication used to access the database (applicable only to MSSQL type). 
Valid values\: sql, windows (for MSSQL)
default value\: sql
    dbClass - The classname of the JDBC driver to use.
    dbURL - The url required to load up the driver and make your connection.
    Command - The command to execute.
    Delimiter - The delimiter to use between columns in returnResult.
    Key - The key to help keep multiple query results distinct.
    timeout - Seconds to wait before timing out the SQL command execution.
Default values\: 0 
    databasePoolingProperties - Properties for database pooling configuration. This parameter replaces the databasePooling.properties file from 9x version (you may copy-paste the file content here). Pooling is disabled by default. Form more details check the /Library/Operations/Database/JDBC folder description.
Example\: db.pooling.enable\=true

Results\:
    Result - The data of one row. It is delimitered by the Delimiter. 
    columnNames - The names of all the columns returned, separated by Delimiter.
    rowsLeft - The number of rows remaining that match the query.

Responses\:
    more items - More rows are available for retrieval.
    no more items - No more rows are available.
    failure - Failed to execute the command.

Notes\: 
1. SQL statement other than SELECT statement (like INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE) is not supported. In case statements other than SELECT are executed then the operation will fail but the statements might get partially or fully executed in the database.
2. If the column type is , the  returns the name of the JDBC driver instead of the actual column value. In this case, use the 'SQL Query LOB' operation instead.
4d9997ee-411c-4da5-a0b5-4813e004ceda.8eeaae7f-d28b-4621-9aff-6150f380eac0.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults".

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
4d9997ee-411c-4da5-a0b5-4813e004ceda.a5a94ff0-ca8a-4618-aa1b-7e5ef5d46c91.prompt=instance\: 4d9997ee-411c-4da5-a0b5-4813e004ceda.bbfb4108-42ab-4045-a82c-447edca9fbd9.description=
Runs a SQL SELECT query.
The first row is returned on the first run of the operation.
Subsequent calls with the same information will return the other rows.

Inputs\:
    DBServerName - The hostname or ip address of db server.
    DbType - The type of database to connect to. 
Valid values\: Oracle, MSSQL, Sybase, Netcool, DB2 and Custom.
Default value\: Oracle
    Username - The username to use when connecting to the server.
    Password -  The password to use when connecting to ther server.
    instance - The name instance of MSSQL Server. Leave it blank for default instance.
    DbPort - The port to connect to.
Default values\: Oracle\: 1521, MSSQL\: 1433, Sybase\: 5000, Netcool\: 4100, DB2\: 50000.
    Database - The name of the database.
    authenticationType - The type of authentication used to access the database (applicable only to MSSQL type). 
Valid values\: sql, windows (for MSSQL)
default value\: sql
    dbClass - The classname of the JDBC driver to use.
    dbURL - The url required to load up the driver and make your connection.
    Command - The command to execute.
    Delimiter - The delimiter to use between columns in returnResult.
    Key - The key to help keep multiple query results distinct.
    timeout - Seconds to wait before timing out the SQL command execution.
Default values\: 0 
    databasePoolingProperties - Properties for database pooling configuration. This parameter replaces the databasePooling.properties file from 9x version (you may copy-paste the file content here). Pooling is disabled by default. Form more details check the /Library/Operations/Database/JDBC folder description.
Example\: db.pooling.enable\=true

Results\:
    Result - The data of one row. It is delimitered by the Delimiter. 
    columnNames - The names of all the columns returned, separated by Delimiter.
    rowsLeft - The number of rows remaining that match the query.

Responses\:
    more items - More rows are available for retrieval.
    no more items - No more rows are available.
    failure - Failed to execute the command.

Notes\: 
1. SQL statement other than SELECT statement (like INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE) is not supported. In case statements other than SELECT are executed then the operation will fail but the statements might get partially or fully executed in the database.
2. If the column type is , the  returns the name of the JDBC driver instead of the actual column value. In this case, use the 'SQL Query LOB' operation instead.
4d9997ee-411c-4da5-a0b5-4813e004ceda.bce83404-201c-40ce-a7c9-d33af923ee23.description=
Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
4d9997ee-411c-4da5-a0b5-4813e004ceda.c64cf005-f052-4704-b630-c3c9d34273b3.description=
Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
4d9997ee-411c-4da5-a0b5-4813e004ceda.description=
Gets a table containing all the rows returned by a SQL query.

Inputs\:
    host -The  hostname or ip address of db server.
    DbType - The type of database to connect to.  
Valid values\: Oracle, MSSQL, Sybase, Netcool, DB2 and Custom.
    username - The username to connect to the database.
    password - The password for the username.
Default value\: Oracle
    instance - The name instance of MSSQL Server. Leave it blank for default instance.
    DBPort - The port to connect to the database.  
Default value\: Oracle\: 1521, MSSQL\: 1433, Sybase\: 5000, Netcool\: 4100, DB2\: 50000. 
    Database - The name of the database.
    authenticationType - The type of authentication used to access the database (applicable only to MSSQL type). 
Valid values\: sql, windows (for MSSQL)
Default value\: sql
    dbClass - The classname of the JDBC driver to use.
    dbURL - The url required to load up the driver and make your connection.
    Command - The command to execute.
    Key - The key to help keep multiple query results distinct. 
    rowDelimiter - The delimiter to use between rows in resulting table.
Default value\: pipe (|)
    columnDelimiter - The delimiter to use between columns in resulting table.
Default value\: comma (,)
    timeout - Seconds to wait before timing out the SQL command execution.
Default value\: 0
    databasePoolingProperties - Properties for database pooling configuration. This parameter replaces the databasePooling.properties file from 9x version (you may copy-paste the file content here). Pooling is disabled by default. Form more details check the /Library/Operations/Database/JDBC folder description.
Example\: db.pooling.enable\=true

Results\:
    Result -  A list containing all the data returned by the query. It is delimited by rowDelimiter and columnDelimiter.
    rows -  A list containing all the data returned by the query. It is delimited by rowDelimiter and columnDelimiter.

Responses\:
    success - The table was built, and the query was executed successfully.
    failure - Something went wrong.

Note\:
1. Use the 'Command' input with caution as it can expose the target system to security risks. By exposing the 'Command' input as a prompt to the user, it will enable the user to execute any SQL command on the target system taking into account the permissions of the credentials given as inputs.
flow.name: Get All Rows
